file_content.text: I can't wait to see those rebels eat laser.
The turrets are ready for reprogramming.
Hail the Emperor! I owe you my thanks and far more.
I'll arrange a payment from the Corps of Engineers directly into your accounts.
The Corps of Engineers will more than compensate you for your service.
Now those rebels will see how lucky they are to be part of the glorious Empire!
The sooner those turrets are repaired, the sooner we can turn them against the rebels.
These blasted Balmorrans have no idea what's good for them.
They should have fallen to their knees in gratitude when we first offered to bring them into the glory of the Empire!
One way or the other, we will bring them to their knees.
They will learn.
Well said, my lord. Perhaps you wouldn't mind assisting me with a small problem?
It's amazing how rarely that happens.
You'd think, right?
Then we must teach them their error. Perhaps you'd like to help me with a quick lesson?
People's loyalty is bought more easily with credits than with a blaster to the head.
Try paying them.
So, if the price is right, would you assist me?
Are you asking for something?
There'd better be a reason you're wasting my time.
Watch yourself.
I meant no offense. You looked to me like patriots who might be willing to help me with a small problem.
I'm sorry, my lord. I was out of line. May I beg your indulgence to assist me with a small problem?
There is. Just hear me out.
Last week, those wretched rebels managed to reprogram the defense turrets around Sobrik to detect and target Imperial troops.
The engineers I sent to fix them were massacred. My only hope is to find someone willing to brave both the rebels and the turrets themselves to repair them.
These rebels must learn they have no chance against the Empire.
I can help.
Thank you.
I assume you've got the credits to back up that request?
I'll help.
Convince me.
I lost my best engineers to this threat. If you stop it, you're welcome to all I would have paid them.
The turrets are scattered around the perimeter of the city and guarded well by rebel spies.
You'll need to use this to neutralize their defenses, then upload this code to allow us to reprogram the proper targets.
Those rebels will pay for their impertinence with their lives.
You do it. [Refuse quest]
Maybe I just will!
I'm a proud member of the Imperial Corps of Engineers!
